pullRequest.body:
Define an orthonormal basis on a pi space from a family of orthonormal bases. 

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Do we have this anywhere?
```lean
protected def _root_.LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCongrRight {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑] {ùïú : Type*} [Semiring ùïú] {E F : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*}
    [‚àÄ i, SeminormedAddCommGroup (E i)] [‚àÄ i, SeminormedAddCommGroup (F i)]
    [‚àÄ i, Module ùïú (E i)] [‚àÄ i, Module ùïú (F i)] {p} [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)] (e : ‚àÄ i, E i ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] F i) :
    PiLp p E ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] PiLp p F where
  toLinearEquiv :=
    WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (LinearEquiv.piCongrRight fun i => (e i).toLinearEquiv)
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm
  norm_map' := (WithLp.linearEquiv p ùïú _).symm.surjective.forall.2 fun x => by
    simp only [LinearEquiv.trans_apply, LinearEquiv.piCongrRight_apply,
      LinearEquiv.apply_symm_apply]
    simp
    obtain rfl | hp := p.dichotomy
    ¬∑ simp_rw [PiLp.norm_equiv_symm,  Pi.norm_def, LinearEquiv.piCongrRight_apply]
      simp
    ¬∑ have : 0 < p.toReal := zero_lt_one.trans_le <| by norm_cast
      simp [PiLp.norm_eq_sum this]
```
I PR'd it in #12437

With that in place, you can now write this as
```lean
variable (ùïú) in
/-- `Equiv.piCurry` for `PiLp` -/
def _root_.LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry {Œπ : Type*} {Œ∫ : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} (p) [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)]
    [Fintype Œπ] [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œ∫ i)]
    (Œ± : ‚àÄ i, Œ∫ i ‚Üí Type*) [‚àÄ i k, SeminormedAddCommGroup (Œ± i k)] [‚àÄ i k, Module ùïú (Œ± i k)] :
    PiLp p (fun i : Sigma _ => Œ± i.1 i.2) ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] PiLp p (fun i => PiLp p (Œ± i)) where
  toLinearEquiv :=
    WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó
        -- this should be `LinearEquiv.piCurry`
        { Equiv.piCurry Œ± with
          map_add' := fun _ _ => rfl
          map_smul' := fun _ _ => rfl }
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (LinearEquiv.piCongrRight fun i => (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm)
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm
  norm_map' := (WithLp.equiv p _).symm.surjective.forall.2 fun x => by
    simp
    sorry

/-- `Pi.orthonormalBasis (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i))` is the
`Œ£ i, Œπ i`-indexed orthonormal basis on `Œ† i, E i` given by `B i` on each component. -/
protected def _root_.Pi.orthonormalBasis {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑] {Œπ : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*}
    [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œπ i)] {ùïú : Type*} [RCLike ùïú] {E : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*} [‚àÄ i, NormedAddCommGroup (E i)]
    [‚àÄ i, InnerProductSpace ùïú (E i)] (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i)) :
    OrthonormalBasis ((i : Œ∑) √ó Œπ i) ùïú (PiLp 2 E) where
  repr := .trans
    (.piLpCongrRight 2 fun i => (B i).repr)
    (.symm <| .piLpCurry ùïú 2 fun _ _ => ùïú)
```

with the main benefit that `LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry` is a much more general result.

> With that in place, you can now write this as
> 
> ```lean
> variable (ùïú) in
> /-- `Equiv.piCurry` for `PiLp` -/
> def _root_.LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry {Œπ : Type*} {Œ∫ : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} (p) [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)]
>     [Fintype Œπ] [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œ∫ i)]
>     (Œ± : ‚àÄ i, Œ∫ i ‚Üí Type*) [‚àÄ i k, SeminormedAddCommGroup (Œ± i k)] [‚àÄ i k, Module ùïú (Œ± i k)] :
>     PiLp p (fun i : Sigma _ => Œ± i.1 i.2) ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] PiLp p (fun i => PiLp p (Œ± i)) where
>   toLinearEquiv :=
>     WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _
>       ‚â™‚â´‚Çó
>         -- this should be `LinearEquiv.piCurry`
>         { Equiv.piCurry Œ± with
>           map_add' := fun _ _ => rfl
>           map_smul' := fun _ _ => rfl }
>       ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (LinearEquiv.piCongrRight fun i => (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm)
>       ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm
>   norm_map' := (WithLp.equiv p _).symm.surjective.forall.2 fun x => by
>     simp
>     sorry
> 
> /-- `Pi.orthonormalBasis (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i))` is the
> `Œ£ i, Œπ i`-indexed orthonormal basis on `Œ† i, E i` given by `B i` on each component. -/
> protected def _root_.Pi.orthonormalBasis {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑] {Œπ : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*}
>     [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œπ i)] {ùïú : Type*} [RCLike ùïú] {E : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*} [‚àÄ i, NormedAddCommGroup (E i)]
>     [‚àÄ i, InnerProductSpace ùïú (E i)] (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i)) :
>     OrthonormalBasis ((i : Œ∑) √ó Œπ i) ùïú (PiLp 2 E) where
>   repr := .trans
>     (.piLpCongrRight 2 fun i => (B i).repr)
>     (.symm <| .piLpCurry ùïú 2 fun _ _ => ùïú)
> ```
> 
> with the main benefit that `LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry` is a much more general result.

Thanks for the suggestion. However, I have been able to complete the proof of `LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry` in the case `p ‚â† ‚ä§`, but not in the case `p = ‚ä§`. I would need to apply [`iSup_sigma`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/CompleteLattice.html#iSup_sigma) to conclude but this result needs a `CompleteLattice` and `‚Ñù` is not a CompleteLattice. So I am a bit stuck...
I realize that this is getting a bit out of hand; I'm ok with you restoring the older version if you want to just get something in; I can always do the generalizations in a later PR.

> I realize that this is getting a bit out of hand; I'm ok with you restoring the older version if you want to just get something in; I can always do the generalizations in a later PR.

Thanks for all the work you do to improve on this PR. I do not have an urgent need for its content yet so it can wait for the generalizations.

@eric-wieser Thanks a lot for your help on this PR. However, I am trying to use it and I get an error that I do not understand. I am trying to build an orthonormal basis of `Œ∑ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ` using the orthonormal basis `Complex.orthonormalBasisOneI`. The code is the following
```lean
import Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.PiL2

noncomputable section

variable {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑]

example : OrthonormalBasis (Œ∑ √ó Fin 2) ‚Ñù (PiLp 2 fun _ : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) := by
  let B := Pi.orthonormalBasis (fun _ : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ Complex.orthonormalBasisOneI)
  let e := Equiv.sigmaEquivProd Œ∑ (Fin 2)
  exact OrthonormalBasis.reindex B e
```
I got the following error: 
```
application type mismatch
  B.reindex
argument
  B
has type
  @OrthonormalBasis ((_ : Œ∑) √ó Fin 2) ‚Ñù Real.RCLike (PiLp 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) (PiLp.normedAddCommGroup 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ)
    (PiLp.innerProductSpace fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) Sigma.instFintype : Type u_1
but is expected to have type
  @OrthonormalBasis ((_ : Œ∑) √ó Fin 2) ‚Ñù Real.RCLike (PiLp 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) (PiLp.normedAddCommGroup 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ)
    InnerProductSpace.complexToReal Sigma.instFintype : Type u_1
```
So there seems to be a problem reconciling  `PiLp.innerProductSpace fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ` and `InnerProductSpace.complexToReal`. I am not sure though if this a problem specific to `Pi.OrthonormalBasis` or a larger issue.

Hum, after further investigations, it seems the problem is not related to this PR but a more general diamond concerning `EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ` seen as a real inner product space. 
```lean
import Mathlib

variable {Œπ : Type*} [Fintype Œπ]

example :
  (InnerProductSpace.complexToReal : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù (EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ))
    = (PiLp.innerProductSpace _ : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù (EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ)) := rfl
```
fails. It fact, it reduces to the following which is not defeq:
```
Œπ : Type u_1
inst‚úù : Fintype Œπ
x‚úù¬π x‚úù : EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ
‚ä¢ ‚ü™x‚úù¬π, x‚úù‚ü´_‚Ñù = Finset.univ.sum fun i ‚Ü¶ ‚ü™x‚úù¬π i, x‚úù I‚ü´_‚Ñù
```
I guess I should post that on Zulip instead...

> I guess I should post that on Zulip instead...

Did this ever happen?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9491848033/job/26158016807)

bors merge

Thanks for your patience, and sorry for the delay!
@eric-wieser is this ready for you?

bors merge

Thanks for your patience, and sorry for the delay!

This is not well-typed, it should be `(Pi.basis (fun i : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ (B i).toBasis)).map (WithLp.linearEquiv 2 _ _).symm`

The lemma below needs to change too.
With that, the next subgoal is `simp [LinearMap.stdBasis, (B j.fst).orthonormal.1 j.snd]`

Yes, indeed. I am still not very confortable with all these type synonym. It is too bad the second subgoal stays still a bit tricky to prove ;)  

Thanks
Eric, why do we review the same PRs? I was just looking at this and about to make this comment! (I'm not actually upset, but you're too quick!)
What's the coe referring to in this lemma? As far as I can tell the LHS is the same as the one below (and in both cases, the RHS has the wrong type)
One way you can test if something is well-typed is to replace it with `by with_reducible exact`, and see if there is an error.
as far as I can tell, we just don't want this lemma at all because I think the only thing it can mean is defeq abuse.
I think the version we want has `(PiLp.equiv _ _).symm (Pi.single _ (B i j))` or similar on the RHS
Ok. I have deleted `Pi.orthonormalBasis_coe_apply` and (hopefully) fixed the type in `Pi.orthonormalBasis_apply`

Do we really want this to be `simp`? The RHS looks a little complicated...

Similarly below.
I guess the idea is that it is a first step toward further simplification... Well, maybe `Pi.orthonormalBasis.toBasis` does not need to be a `simp`, but I think the next two lemmas should be `simp`.
Ok, fair enough!

```suggestion
open Classical in
/-- `Pi.orthonormalBasis (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i))` is the
`Œ£ i, Œπ i`-indexed orthonormal basis on `Œ† i, E i` given by `B i` on each component. -/
protected noncomputable def _root_.Pi.orthonormalBasis {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑] {Œπ : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*}
    [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œπ i)] {ùïú : Type*} [RCLike ùïú] {E : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*} [‚àÄ i, NormedAddCommGroup (E i)]
    [‚àÄ i, InnerProductSpace ùïú (E i)] (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i)) :
    OrthonormalBasis ((i : Œ∑) √ó (Œπ i)) ùïú (PiLp 2 fun i : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ (E i)) :=
  Basis.toOrthonormalBasis 
    ((Pi.basis (fun i : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ (B i).toBasis)).map (WithLp.linearEquiv 2 _ _).symm) <| by
    refine ‚ü®fun j ‚Ü¶ ?_, fun ‚ü®j, k‚ü© ‚ü®j', k'‚ü© _h ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
    ¬∑ simp [LinearMap.stdBasis, (B j.fst).orthonormal.1 j.snd]
    ¬∑ simp_rw [Basis.map_apply, Pi.basis_apply, LinearMap.stdBasis, WithLp.linearEquiv_symm_apply,
        PiLp.inner_apply, OrthonormalBasis.coe_toBasis, LinearMap.coe_single,
        WithLp.equiv_symm_pi_apply, ‚Üê Finset.sum_erase_add Finset.univ _ (Finset.mem_univ j)]
      rw [Finset.sum_eq_zero (fun _ h ‚Ü¶ ?_), zero_add, Pi.single_eq_same]
      ¬∑ obtain rfl | hj := eq_or_ne j j'
        ¬∑ rw [Pi.single_eq_same]
          exact (B j).orthonormal.2 (ne_of_apply_ne _ _h)
        ¬∑ rw [Pi.single_eq_of_ne hj, inner_zero_right]
      ¬∑ rw [Pi.single_eq_of_ne (Finset.ne_of_mem_erase h), inner_zero_left]
```
Using tactic mode for definitions is not ideal: unlike for proofs, we actually care afterwards about the precise form of the term that is generated. Here it turns out to be pretty easy to restrict tactic mode to the actual proof of orthonormality rather than using it for the whole definition.
Great! Thanks. I am not so good at using term mode üòÖ

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Basis.toOrthonormalBasis ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```
You probably want `obtain rfl | hp := p.dichotomy`
I've split these to #12474

```suggestion
theorem reindex_toBasis (b : OrthonormalBasis Œπ ùïú E) (e : Œπ ‚âÉ Œπ') :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Define `Pi.orthonormalBasis`

nodes.body:
Do we have this anywhere?
```lean
protected def _root_.LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCongrRight {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑] {ùïú : Type*} [Semiring ùïú] {E F : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*}
    [‚àÄ i, SeminormedAddCommGroup (E i)] [‚àÄ i, SeminormedAddCommGroup (F i)]
    [‚àÄ i, Module ùïú (E i)] [‚àÄ i, Module ùïú (F i)] {p} [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)] (e : ‚àÄ i, E i ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] F i) :
    PiLp p E ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] PiLp p F where
  toLinearEquiv :=
    WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (LinearEquiv.piCongrRight fun i => (e i).toLinearEquiv)
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm
  norm_map' := (WithLp.linearEquiv p ùïú _).symm.surjective.forall.2 fun x => by
    simp only [LinearEquiv.trans_apply, LinearEquiv.piCongrRight_apply,
      LinearEquiv.apply_symm_apply]
    simp
    obtain rfl | hp := p.dichotomy
    ¬∑ simp_rw [PiLp.norm_equiv_symm,  Pi.norm_def, LinearEquiv.piCongrRight_apply]
      simp
    ¬∑ have : 0 < p.toReal := zero_lt_one.trans_le <| by norm_cast
      simp [PiLp.norm_eq_sum this]
```
I PR'd it in #12437

With that in place, you can now write this as
```lean
variable (ùïú) in
/-- `Equiv.piCurry` for `PiLp` -/
def _root_.LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry {Œπ : Type*} {Œ∫ : Œπ ‚Üí Type*} (p) [Fact (1 ‚â§ p)]
    [Fintype Œπ] [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œ∫ i)]
    (Œ± : ‚àÄ i, Œ∫ i ‚Üí Type*) [‚àÄ i k, SeminormedAddCommGroup (Œ± i k)] [‚àÄ i k, Module ùïú (Œ± i k)] :
    PiLp p (fun i : Sigma _ => Œ± i.1 i.2) ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[ùïú] PiLp p (fun i => PiLp p (Œ± i)) where
  toLinearEquiv :=
    WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó
        -- this should be `LinearEquiv.piCurry`
        { Equiv.piCurry Œ± with
          map_add' := fun _ _ => rfl
          map_smul' := fun _ _ => rfl }
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (LinearEquiv.piCongrRight fun i => (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm)
      ‚â™‚â´‚Çó (WithLp.linearEquiv _ _ _).symm
  norm_map' := (WithLp.equiv p _).symm.surjective.forall.2 fun x => by
    simp
    sorry

/-- `Pi.orthonormalBasis (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i))` is the
`Œ£ i, Œπ i`-indexed orthonormal basis on `Œ† i, E i` given by `B i` on each component. -/
protected def _root_.Pi.orthonormalBasis {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑] {Œπ : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*}
    [‚àÄ i, Fintype (Œπ i)] {ùïú : Type*} [RCLike ùïú] {E : Œ∑ ‚Üí Type*} [‚àÄ i, NormedAddCommGroup (E i)]
    [‚àÄ i, InnerProductSpace ùïú (E i)] (B : ‚àÄ i, OrthonormalBasis (Œπ i) ùïú (E i)) :
    OrthonormalBasis ((i : Œ∑) √ó Œπ i) ùïú (PiLp 2 E) where
  repr := .trans
    (.piLpCongrRight 2 fun i => (B i).repr)
    (.symm <| .piLpCurry ùïú 2 fun _ _ => ùïú)
```

with the main benefit that `LinearIsometryEquiv.piLpCurry` is a much more general result.

@eric-wieser Thanks a lot for your help on this PR. However, I am trying to use it and I get an error that I do not understand. I am trying to build an orthonormal basis of `Œ∑ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ` using the orthonormal basis `Complex.orthonormalBasisOneI`. The code is the following
```lean
import Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.PiL2

noncomputable section

variable {Œ∑ : Type*} [Fintype Œ∑]

example : OrthonormalBasis (Œ∑ √ó Fin 2) ‚Ñù (PiLp 2 fun _ : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) := by
  let B := Pi.orthonormalBasis (fun _ : Œ∑ ‚Ü¶ Complex.orthonormalBasisOneI)
  let e := Equiv.sigmaEquivProd Œ∑ (Fin 2)
  exact OrthonormalBasis.reindex B e
```
I got the following error: 
```
application type mismatch
  B.reindex
argument
  B
has type
  @OrthonormalBasis ((_ : Œ∑) √ó Fin 2) ‚Ñù Real.RCLike (PiLp 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) (PiLp.normedAddCommGroup 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ)
    (PiLp.innerProductSpace fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) Sigma.instFintype : Type u_1
but is expected to have type
  @OrthonormalBasis ((_ : Œ∑) √ó Fin 2) ‚Ñù Real.RCLike (PiLp 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ) (PiLp.normedAddCommGroup 2 fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ)
    InnerProductSpace.complexToReal Sigma.instFintype : Type u_1
```
So there seems to be a problem reconciling  `PiLp.innerProductSpace fun x ‚Ü¶ ‚ÑÇ` and `InnerProductSpace.complexToReal`. I am not sure though if this a problem specific to `Pi.OrthonormalBasis` or a larger issue.

Hum, after further investigations, it seems the problem is not related to this PR but a more general diamond concerning `EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ` seen as a real inner product space. 
```lean
import Mathlib

variable {Œπ : Type*} [Fintype Œπ]

example :
  (InnerProductSpace.complexToReal : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù (EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ))
    = (PiLp.innerProductSpace _ : InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù (EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ)) := rfl
```
fails. It fact, it reduces to the following which is not defeq:
```
Œπ : Type u_1
inst‚úù : Fintype Œπ
x‚úù¬π x‚úù : EuclideanSpace ‚ÑÇ Œπ
‚ä¢ ‚ü™x‚úù¬π, x‚úù‚ü´_‚Ñù = Finset.univ.sum fun i ‚Ü¶ ‚ü™x‚úù¬π i, x‚úù I‚ü´_‚Ñù
```
I guess I should post that on Zulip instead...
